item.title: Report X-2025030266
item.description:
Report X-2025030266

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-06
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Jonathan Ellis, 149 Operations Supervisor, contacted Safety regarding a UN3378 Sodium Carbonate spill on the trailer floor. Jonathan Ellis advised 4 drums on 1 pallet and is unsure what drum the spill is coming from. Jonathan Ellis stated the freight was blocked and braced tightly with other freight on the trailer. Jonathan Ellis also advised that he does not see any punctures. Jonathan Ellis stated the trailer does have powdered milk on the trailer but believes the spill is UN3378 due to the residue on the pallet of UN3378. Brock Sisney with CURA has been contacted for remediation.

item.title: Report E-2025030066
item.description:
Report E-2025030066

Identified by scraper @ 2025-03-16T21:12:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-27
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 27, 2025, two (2) 1-gallon pails of UN1993 were crushed and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums.
